stream_context.summary: Kaze focuses on building the overworld: modeling a Pachyderm gatekeeper, wiring star-locked doors, planning save-flag logic, and brainstorming an intro cut-scene where a Nep-enut destroys Mario’s boat. He also debates split-screen co-op performance and other design choices with chat while troubleshooting Fast64 and Blender.

development_findings.summary: Total stars have risen from an original 185 to 193, and Kaze expects at least seven more overworld stars.
development_findings.quote: We started with a hack that had planned to have like 185 stars and now we have 193.

development_findings.summary: Course 2 bug-fixing is nearly finished off-stream and should be done by the end of the week; a Course 7 test is coming soon.
development_findings.quote: I think I'll be done with it by the end of the week. Hopefully I can get my course 7 test done soon.

development_findings.summary: Overworld tasks listed: Pachyderm toll gate, temple door that opens after grabbing a star, warp cannon, and a bunny mission in Brushwoods.
development_findings.quote: We need a bop to bunny Brushwoods… Temple door as a standard, collect the star and the door opens itself… and then with the cannon at part four exit.

development_findings.summary: Prototype Pachyderm model created in Blender (~242 triangles) using a pear mesh as base; Kaze plans to refine and low-poly it further.
development_findings.quote: Dude, he is pear-shaped… 242 triangles, I think we're fine.

development_findings.summary: Intro cut-scene concept: Mario’s boat arrives, a Nep-enut eats it, forcing Mario to swim ashore while learning the swim controls and glimpsing the island.
development_findings.quote: Mario arrives at Yoshi's Island. He immediately gets mauled by a Nap-E-Nut… Mario then swims in the island while learning swimming controls.

development_findings.summary: Discussed alternate level-1 gate designs: coin-paying Pachyderm, TNT, Bob-omb, rolling boulder. Decision still pending but goal is to make players explore hub first.
development_findings.quote: I think I really, really want the player to collect 10 coins… but I see a point of it being somewhat of a chore.

development_findings.summary: Save-flag system overhauled: new ‘event flags’ block in EEPROM because 17 overworld stars exceed existing Castle Secret Star bits.
development_findings.quote: We might need to make new space for save flags in the EEP room… 17. So these 16 bits are no good.

development_findings.summary: Split-screen co-op research: will letterbox each half-screen to keep 16:9, reducing pixels; predicts 30 → 20 FPS but deems acceptable; will reference ‘closest player state’ for interactions.
development_findings.quote: I think multiplayer is probably going to drop an RSP on 30 FPS level to 20 FPS… Instead of G Mario states, we always read G closest player state.

development_findings.summary: Fast64 redraw crash when adding materials forces switch to Eevee; indicates ongoing toolchain instability.
development_findings.quote: There's some sort of bug with the Fast64 Redrun that means I can't add any more materials.

development_findings.summary: AI-generated models/textures tested but deemed too high-poly or ugly; Kaze still relies on manual work.
development_findings.quote: Everything they've posted looked absolutely horrendous… Obviously way too high poly.

context_findings.summary: Kaze’s design philosophy: invest heavily in tools/knowledge before tackling tasks (referencing ‘sharpening the axe’ quote).
context_findings.quote: We try to improve our tools, gather as much knowledge as possible, and then start the task so we can finish the task as fast as possible.

context_findings.summary: He expresses skepticism toward mainstream AI hype but excitement for future practical uses that remove chores.
context_findings.quote: I am excited for the possibility of AI to do the parts that I don't like doing, but I don't think we are anywhere near done.

context_findings.summary: Personal life: his robotic lawn-mower returned from repair and he plans to glue googly eyes on it; light-hearted moment reflects work-life mix.
context_findings.quote: You guys will all be rejoiced to hear that I have my lawnmower back… I have googly eyes ready that I'm gonna glue onto him.

context_findings.summary: Considers laser eye surgery for ‘absolute banger vision.’
context_findings.quote: Guys, I think I want laser eye surgery at some point in the future.

context_findings.summary: Shows frustration with Fast64 bugs and Blender crashes but remains upbeat: ‘finally getting to program the overworld feels crazy.’
context_findings.quote: Man, finally getting to program the overworld feels crazy.

biobak.summary: Currently reworking a stage and requested a smaller mission; Kaze avoids editing that stage while Biobak works.
biobak.quote: Biobak is actually working on reworking this one right now. He wanted a smaller mission.

biobak.summary: In discussion about level-1 gate, Biobak questions whether Pachyderm toll is a good idea, influencing design debate.

zeina.summary: Animating a ball-breaking scene; progress acknowledged on stream.
zeina.quote: Zeina's working on the animation right now.

key_stories.title: Star-count creep
key_stories.summary: The project ballooned from 185 planned stars to 193 so far, with at least seven more likely in the overworld.
key_stories.process: Kaze reviews content list and acknowledges incremental additions.
key_stories.outcome: Team will search for seven new overworld stars; acknowledges mild scope creep but accepts it.
key_stories.key_quote: Holy scope creep… We started with a hack that had planned to have like 185 stars and now we have 193.

key_stories.title: Designing the first gate
key_stories.summary: How to block Course 1 so players explore the hub: Pachyderm toll, TNT, Bob-omb, or rolling boulder?
key_stories.challenge: Preventing a ‘chore’ while teaching overworld exploration.
key_stories.process: Live debate with chat and Biobak; modeled Pachyderm, weighed pros/cons, brainstormed alternatives.
key_stories.outcome: No final decision; issue logged for further testing.
key_stories.key_quote: I think I really, really want the player to collect 10 coins… but I see a point of it being somewhat of a chore.

key_stories.title: Nep-enut intro cut-scene
key_stories.summary: Kaze decides the opening cinematic: a Nep-enut eats Mario’s boat, forcing a swim tutorial and showcasing the island.
key_stories.challenge: Give narrative context and teach swimming without a separate tutorial level.
key_stories.process: Scrapped stormy-night idea; wrote outline live and removed static boat model from overworld.
key_stories.outcome: Concept approved; to be scripted later, with Nap-enuts making water hazardous.
key_stories.key_quote: Mario arrives at Yoshi's Island. He immediately gets mauled by a Nap-E-Nut.

key_stories.title: Co-op performance dilemma
key_stories.summary: Investigating split-screen multiplayer while maintaining playability on original hardware.
key_stories.challenge: Rendering two views taxes N64; dialogue halts both players.
key_stories.process: Proposes letterboxed half-screens to lower pixel count; uses ‘closest player state’; brainstorms dialogue swaps and hit-switch mechanics.
key_stories.outcome: Believes 20 FPS acceptable; feature remains experimental.
key_stories.key_quote: 20 FPS on the N64, honestly, is it that bad? Ocarina of Time was 20 FPS.

open_questions.context: Multiple ideas (coin-paying Pachyderm, TNT, Bob-omb, rolling boulder) were discussed but no choice made.

open_questions.context: Kaze theorized performance and interaction fixes but hasn’t built a prototype.

open_questions.context: Kaze mentioned ‘some legal issues right now, but don't worry, he will be paid.’

open_questions.context: Need more bits for overworld event flags; Kaze started reallocating EEPROM.

open_questions.context: Kaze tested AI models/textures but rejected them; interested if quality improves.
